dialogue: Greetings, traveler!
What are you doing here, in this grim dungeon?
Wandering without a purpose in such a place is dangerous...
Be careful, these walls hold more than just dust.
Stay safe, wanderer. Darkness is unforgiving.
responses: I'm not afraid of the dark.

dialogue: Long ago, a demon was imprisoned here.
I tried to drive it away myself, but it seems... I failed.
Think carefully before wandering deeper.
I was... once I was Galderion the Shaded, highest of the Council of Light.
Now I am just an old wizard trying to find a way out.
May your path be brighter than mine.
responses: Maybe I can help you find the exit.
How did you lose your way?

dialogue: Magic here is twisted. Every turn changes its shape.
I tried using my orb of light, but it went out...
Beware the tricks of this place.
If you have a flame pure of heart, it might work.
Take this orb and touch it with your light.
Even a small spark can light the darkest path.
responses: I don't know if I have enough power.

dialogue: The orb glows... the room shifts... beams of light reveal a new path!
Excellent! You may be the one to guide me out of here.
The light will guide you, take care.
responses: You go first, I'll protect you.
I won't trust you so easily, old wizard.

dialogue: Then you are either brave... or foolish.
We'll see which it is.
Bravery has its price, tread wisely.
responses: Only fools sit in darkness and wait for light.

dialogue: Ha! You have a sharp tongue. I like that.
Perhaps you truly have the spark that can ignite this orb.
Keep your spark alive, it may save you.
responses: Tell me more about this orb.
How will it help us escape?

dialogue: Treasure, you say? Here you'll find only dust and regret.
But... maybe you can find something that once belonged to me.
Greed can blind even the keenest eyes.
responses: If there's a reward, I can help.

dialogue: My staff — it was made of blue crystal.
Without it, I am nothing more than an old man with long hair.
A lost artifact can cost more than gold.
responses: Where did you last see it?

dialogue: It fell into the deep hall guarded by stone golems.
I cannot enter there anymore... but you, perhaps, can.
Only the brave may claim what is lost.
responses: I will retrieve it for you.

dialogue: You honor me, traveler.
Bring it, and I will show you the portal of light that leads outside.
May fortune favor your steps.
I understand... fear is natural.
Perhaps another time, when you are ready.
Caution is wise, but opportunity may pass.
Indeed... I have been trapped in this dungeon for days.
The tunnels shift, and my mind grows foggy.
Even small help can be the difference between life and death.
responses: I can help you get out.

dialogue: My magic no longer obeys me. This place twists it.
Every spell here becomes a whisper in a demon's ear.
Beware, some places are alive and watchful.
responses: Then I will help without magic.
This sounds horrifying... I will only stay a moment.

dialogue: Then you are brave and pure of heart.
If we escape, I will grant you a blessing — the Flame of the Old Light.
Your courage will not be forgotten.
Help me lift this heavy wheel — under it lies a passage.
I can no longer do it alone.
Every effort has its reward.
With your strength, it worked!
Beneath the wheel, a dark tunnel opens... perhaps there is an exit.
The path ahead will test you.
Ha, smart move. Alright, but follow closely.
In the darkness, we might lose each other.
Stay close, or the shadows will claim you.
